info.title: NextAPI Partners
info.description: API for NextAPI Partners. For authentication, use Basic Auth with your Client ID as the username and Client Secret as the password. The credentials should be Base64-encoded and included in the Authorization header.

tags.name: Partner
tags.description: A Partner is a business organization that integrates with our payment services. Partners must meet compliance requirements and are granted API access controls to utilize our payment infrastructure.

tags.name: Account
tags.description: An Account is a financial entity that holds funds and manages transactions. Accounts can be owned by a Partner or a Merchant.

tags.name: Account â€” Payment Methods
tags.description: These payment methods are money-in-only ways for anyone to add money to a specific account. The system automatically generates these payment methods (like bank details or QR codes) to help track and reconcile which payments belong to which account. Each account can have multiple types of payment methods, but only one of each type - for example, one bank detail method and one QR code method per account. You can choose which types to enable for the accounts based on the users' needs.

tags.name: Payment Intent
tags.description: A Payment Intent is a request to create a payment to collect funds from a customer. This includes creating a payment, selecting a payment method, generating a QR code, and managing the payment lifecycle.

tags.name: Payment
tags.description: A Payment is a request to send funds to a payment method.

tags.name: Payout Request
tags.description: A Payout Request represents a request to disburse funds. A single request can be split into multiple payouts based on settlement rail limitations (e.g. for an InstaPay payout, the request may be split into multiple payouts to handle the maximum payout amount per transaction).

tags.name: Payout
tags.description: A Payout is an individual disbursement transaction that is part of a Payout Request. Multiple payouts may be created to handle large disbursement amounts that exceed settlement rail limits.

tags.name: Transaction
tags.description: A Transaction is a ledger record that groups related postings (movements of assets between accounts) to ensure they are committed atomically. This model enables complex payment flows by guaranteeing all-or-nothing execution of multiple account transfers.

tags.name: Webhook
tags.description: Registering a Webhook allows you to receive events from the API. You can view the webhook events in the [Models](/docs#models) section.

Basic Auth.description: Authenticate using a Base64-encoded combination of Client ID and Client Secret.

schema.description: This key is unique to ensure that this request is processed only once, preventing duplicate actions. It expires in 24 hours and is scoped specifically to this endpoint and the request body. This means that if a different body is sent with the same key, both requests can still be processed independently.

account_id.description: Unique identifier of the account associated with this payment intent.
account_id.title: Account ID

amount_cents.description: The payment amount in cents to collect. Examples: `100` for `1.00`, `82431` for `824.31`, `500000` for `5,000.00`
amount_cents.title: Amount in Cents

currency.description: ISO 4217 currency code for the payment
currency.title: Currency

intent_created_at.description: Timestamp when the actual payment intent was created by an external system. If not provided, the current timestamp will be used.
intent_created_at.title: Intent Created At

metadata.description: Additional data associated with the payment intent. This is a JSON object.
metadata.title: Metadata

reference_number.description: Unique reference number for the payment intent. This is used to identify the payment intent in the external system.
reference_number.title: Reference Number

type.description: The type of QRPH image to generate
type.title: Type

resolution.description: The resolution of the QRPH image to generate
resolution.title: Resolution

qrph.description: List of payment methods to use.
qrph.title: QRPH Options

rate.description: Percentage rate applied to transaction amount

created_at.title: Created At

updated_at.description: The date and time when this payment method was last modified
updated_at.title: Updated At

type.description: The kind of payment method this represents
type.title: Type

persistence_mode.description: How long this payment method stays available. 'persistent' means it can be used indefinitely until manually disabled. 'temporary' means it will automatically expire after a set time or single use
persistence_mode.title: Persistence Mode

usage_mode.description: How many times this payment method can be used. 'multiple' allows unlimited deposits. 'single' automatically deactivates after the first successful deposit
usage_mode.title: Usage Mode

status.description: Current state of the payment method. 'active' means ready to receive deposits, 'used' means it completed a single-use payment, 'expired' means it timed out or is no longer valid, 'failed' means there was a provider error, 'suspended' means temporarily disabled, 'archived' means permanently disabled
status.title: Status

partner_account_id.description: The ID of the account that will receive funds deposited through this payment method
partner_account_id.title: Partner Account ID

instructions.description: User-facing details needed to use this payment method. For virtual collection accounts, this contains bank account details (account number, bank name, etc.). For QRPH, this contains the base64-encoded QR code image that users can decode and scan to pay.
instructions.title: Instructions

examples.instructions: Transfer any amount to this account using the details above
examples.amount_note: Minimum and maximum amount may apply based on your bank

429.description: Too many requests - rate limit exceeded

title.description: Short, human-readable summary of the problem

detail.description: Detailed explanation specific to this occurrence
detail.example: Rate limit exceeded for this endpoint. Please retry later.
